fact_list.fact_text: Drivers must plan their route well in advance.
Drivers must turn on their vehicle headlights.
Drivers must turn on the radio inside the tunnel.
Drivers must follow the traffic signs inside the tunnel.
Heavy vehicles must keep to the left in the tunnel.
Drivers must stay in lane when in a tunnel.
Drivers must insert cash card in advance for ERP payments.
Drivers must not stop their vehicle unless in the case of an accident, breakdown, emergency, or when lawfully required.
Drivers must not make any U-turns or reverse their vehicle in a tunnel.
Drivers must not alight from their vehicle unless there is an emergency.
Drivers must not use their horn except in an emergency.
Drivers must not change their tyre or wheel in a tunnel.
Drivers must not refuel or repair their vehicle in a tunnel.
Drivers must not overtake other vehicles in a tunnel.
Drivers must not tailgate other vehicles in a tunnel.
Drivers must not speed in a tunnel.
Vehicles prohibited in the tunnel include those not carrying sufficient fuel in their tank.
Vehicles carrying animals or poultry not properly confined or carrying garbage, fine particles, or similar materials not sufficiently covered are prohibited.
Vehicles with a load or the cover of the load not properly secured are prohibited.
Vehicles carrying a person standing on the outside or seated with any part of their body overhanging the sides or rear of the vehicle are prohibited in the tunnel.
Vehicles whose overall height is 4.5 metres or above are prohibited in the tunnel.
